article:
{{Infobox musical artist |name = II D Extreme |image = |caption = |background =
group_or_band |alias = |origin = Washington, D.C. |genre = Hip-Hop New Jack
Swing R&B |years_active = 1993 - present |label = MCA Records Gasoline
Alley Music |associated_acts = Queen Latifah |website = |current_members =
D'Extra Wiley Randy Gill Jermaine Mickey Sage Lee }} 'II D Extreme' was
an American new jack swing/urban R&B group from the early 1990s that included
D'Extra Wiley, Randy Gill (Johnny Gill's brother) and Jermaine Mickey. They are
known for the songs " Cry No More," "Up On The Roof" and Gap Band's cover of
"Outstanding".
categories: American rhythm and blues musical groups
